alert.note: Alert for Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wilson County through 745 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fremont, or 11 miles north of Goldsboro, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilson, Elm City, Sharpsburg, Stantonsburg, Black Creek, Saratoga, Willbanks and New Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
